txt.en: 'Slade Ransford is in Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold of the Lone-lands, and rumour is that he wants to speak with you about some errand that requires the might of a champion.'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed outside the town of Stoneheight
'It was a pleasure to take up arms with you against Mosal-ruk, [placeholder].'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed and tour the town of Stoneheight
'Mosal-ruk's war-band could not hope to stand against the might of two champions!'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed in Stoneheight
'The tale of your deeds at Ost Cyrn are legendary!'
Talk to Brom Hawksbeard in the Bree Jail
'You're [placeholder]? The Song of Slade and [placeholder] at Ost Cyrn is one of my favourites!'
Derwent Bindweed is outside the town of Stoneheight, north-east of Amon Raith in the North Downs.
Derwent Bindweed is outside the town of Stoneheight, at Ann√∫ndir in the North Downs.

'Brom Hawksbeard sent you to me? That was very kind of him, [placeholder], but he's wrong: I am not in any trouble at all, and I am quite enjoying my new home here in Stoneheight!

'And if my neighbours have any needs or concerns at all, I am more than prepared to do my part to set things a-right here; I pulled my weight at Thornley's Work Site for weeks. Were I still there it would no doubt be finished by now! But Bill Ferny and his ruffians saw to that, didn't they?

'So there's no trouble hereabout, but if you are interested I could give you a tour of the town. It's the least I can do, my brawling friend!'
'DNT - Blah!'
Brom Hawksbeard likes to portray himself as a tough Brawler with few cares, but the more you work with him the more you realize his gruff exterior is mostly an act.
Derwent Bindweed is in the town of Stoneheight in the North Downs.

'Right this way, my friend! While we walk, you can tell me why Brom thinks Stoneheight is a place of danger... it seems peaceable to me!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>
Brom Hawksbeard is in the Bree Jail.

'That's two I owe you, my friend! Either trouble follows a Brawler close behind, or you have a knack for finding it! Whichever might be the truth, I am glad you were here! But what will I do if Bill Ferny learns that his Orc-friends were unsuccessful? I cannot keep cowering whenever a fight breaks out....

'Perhaps I will take up the fighting style you demonstrated, [placeholder], and seek to train the folk of Stoneheight in the brawling arts. It could be that Rose and Ned will take to it, and become natural Brawlers in their own right! I begin to wonder if Brom Hawksbeard was right about this town, and we may need skills such as yours to defend ourselves!

'Thank you again, [placeholder], and convey my gratitude to Brom as well! We are lucky you were here! When next I see you, perhaps we will be a brawling pair that fears neither Orc-swords nor the underhanded schemes of villains such as Bill Ferny!'

'Word of your deeds has travelled far, [placeholder], and you have become much sought-after by those who have need of such a champion! I've heard it said that Slade Ransford, himself a champion of no small skill, wants to meet with you to discuss a mission of some urgency.\n\n'Slade makes his home at Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold in the Lone-lands, if you wish to answer his call.'

'I received word that Derwent Bindweed has run into another spot of trouble, [placeholder]. Now, I don't much care, having my own concerns, but as an up-and-coming Brawler you should really do what you can to improve your own reputation among the people of Bree-land.

'It seems Derwent set out looking for a new home for his family after you stood up to Bill Ferny's ruffians, but the town in which he stopped is perhaps even more dangerous than the one he left! Why don't you go check on him and see if you can help? I fear he might have bit off more than he can chew....'

Brom coughs suddenly.

'Fear? Did I say fear? Bah! Brom Hawksbeard fears nothing! I just meant Derwent might be afraid, and could use a strong Brawler to help him get settled! Seek him out at the town of Stoneheight, [placeholder], in the North Downs. I understand you can follow a sloping path north-east of Amon Raith, along the curve of the mountains, right to the town. Once again, making good use of your brawling abilities is the only way to improve them! Surely you want to one day equal my own skill, do you not?'

'Derwent and his family are faring well in Stoneheight? Very good. I was not really concerned, but if you were going up there anyway....'

You tell Brom that you weren't actually going to Stoneheight already, and you only journeyed there on his recommendation.

'Yes, well, you must have been worried about him all the same. At any rate, I have a reward for you. May it help you in whatever brawls lie ahead, whether they be in service of the helpless... or just for fun.'

'Word of your deeds has travelled far, [placeholder], and you have become much sought-after by those who have need of such a champion! I've heard it said that Slade Ransford, himself a champion of no small skill, wants to meet with you to discuss a mission of some urgency.\n\n'Slade makes his home at Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold in the Lone-lands, if you wish to answer his call.'
'DNT - Blah!'

'Thank you again, [placeholder], and convey my gratitude to Brom as well! We are lucky you were here!'
A true champion does not balk even at overwhelming odds, but relishes the opportunity to test his skills against such force.
Talk to Slade Ransford and travel with him to Ost Cyrn
Slade Ransford is at Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold of the Lone-lands.\n\nSlade Ransford has been asking about you, and wishes for you to speak with him about an errand of some sort.
Slade Ransford is in Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold of the Lone-lands.\n\nSlade Ransford is waiting to travel with you to Ost Cyrn to enact his plan to drive out the Orcs that have settled there.
Slade Ransford is in Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold of the Lone-lands.\n\nSlade Ransford is waiting for you to speak with him about the events at Ost Cyrn.

'Word of your deeds has travelled far, [placeholder], and you have become much sought-after by those who have need of such a champion! I've heard it said that Slade Ransford, himself a champion of no small skill, wants to meet with you to discuss a mission of some urgency.\n\n'Slade makes his home at Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold in the Lone-lands, if you wish to answer his call.'

'Are you ready to depart? I know that we can defeat Mosal-ruk and his war-band, and the minstrels will sing of our valour when we return victorious...probably.

'Are you ready to go?'

<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>

'Slade Ransford is in Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold of the Lone-lands, and rumour is that he wants to speak with you about some errand that requires the might of a champion.'

'Welcome, [placeholder]. I heard of your victories in Bree-land and rejoiced in particular that you slew Morley the Fierce. A truer name for him would be \qMorley the False!\q He had long been a foe of my family, and I am glad that you put an end to his villainy.

'It is with confidence that I then ask for your help, [placeholder], for I know you to be a true champion. A band of Orcs have come to the ruins of Ost Cyrn, not far from here, and I know that together we can drive them out. These lands may be wilderness, but every yard of land we allow the Orcs to take brings them one yard closer to Bree-town, and the lands of good folk!

'The leader of these Orcs has the vile name Mosal-ruk, and he, like others of his kind, will not resist a challenge issued from a true champion. Let us journey together to Ost Cyrn, [placeholder], defeat Mosal-ruk's war-band, and put an end to his designs on the Lone-lands!'
'Slade Ransford is in Ost Guruth, the Ruin-hold of the Lone-lands, and rumour is that he wants to speak with you about some errand that requires the might of a champion.'
